alfredsnippet.snippet:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import statsmodels.api as sm
from sklearn import datasets


iris = sns.load_dataset('iris')
iris = sm.datasets.get_rdataset('iris').data
iris = datasets.load_iris().data 

# Datasets available
#----------------------------------------------------------------------
# seaborn :  iris tips titanic diamonds flights exercise mpg etc
#               : print(sns.get_dataset_names())
#
# sm: co2 cancer etc
# statsmodels with R: iris and other thousands of dataset
#
# sklearn: iris wine boston diabetes breast_cancer etc
#            : [ i for i in dir(datasets) if 'load_' in i]
#
#            :  .data gives numpy array
#            : .data .feature_names .target .target_names .filename .DESCR

# Dataset description
#-----------------------------------------------------------------------
# sns: This does not provide data description.
#         only two attributes  'get_dataset_names' and  'load_dataset'
#
# sm: print(sm.datasets.co2.DESCRLONG)
# sm: print(sm.datasets.get_rdataset('iris').__doc__)
#
# sklearn: print(datasets.load_iris().DESCR)
alfredsnippet.name: practice data
